page.title: 14Dovercourt's Old Lighthouses
page.content: The shifting shoals off Harwich have meant that lights have been provided for the guidance of mariners for centuries.The earliiest recorded lighthouses were at Harwich Green in 1664. The two lighthouses formed "leading lights" where mariners must get one light positioned above the other, to be on the correct course through the shoals of the harbour entrance. But the channel for the harbour was changing direction and it was for this reason that the Harwich lights were discontinued in 1863. The result of this was that in 1862 Trinity House built two iron pile "movable " lighthouses on the Dovercourt foreshore, with legal powers to move the structure to any site elsewhere on the foreshore.
